questions.question: PR #9285 added commit hash a876c4f to markazitext METADATA.pb, but the font file in google/fonts predates this commit by 3+ years. Was this intentional to track the 'desired' upstream state, or should the commit hash reference the actual version used to build the deployed fonts?
questions.context: The METADATA.pb references upstream commit a876c4f (Oct 27, 2024) but the actual font file was last updated on Aug 10, 2021 (PR #3644).

questions.question: The Oct 2024 Arabic diacritics fix (commit a876c4f) is not yet deployed to Google Fonts. Would you like us to initiate a font update PR to bring the latest fixes to users?
questions.context: Commit a876c4f contains 'Arabic diacritics fix - Shadda with other marks did not work properly' but this fix is not in the currently deployed Google Fonts version.

questions.question: Should Lora be updated to v3.021? Are there breaking changes or regressions between v3.11 and v3.021 that need review?
questions.context: METADATA.pb references commit c44a1dde (v3.11, Nov 2024) but upstream has v3.021 (Oct 2025). The metadata may not match the actually deployed fonts (v3.008 from PR #7103).

questions.question: Should METADATA.pb be updated to include commit hash 8d9d02bf70c2339aa9e214acebf9ad592273ed81?
questions.context: Fira Sans METADATA.pb has repository_url but no commit hash. The FiraGFVersion repo has been dormant since Dec 2016.

questions.question: Is FiraGFVersion the canonical upstream or was the font originally from Mozilla's Fira?
questions.context: FiraGFVersion appears to be a Google Fonts-specific fork. The original Fira was created by Mozilla.

questions.question: Do these 14 fonts have private upstream repositories or were they contributed as binaries only? If sources exist, can we get repository URLs?
questions.context: These fonts have no discoverable public source repositories: (Korean foundries) Black And White Picture (AsiaSoft Inc.), Cute Font (TypoDesign Lab. Inc), Dokdo (FONTRIX), Gaegu (JIKJI SOFT), Gothic A1 (HanYang I&C Co), Gugi (TAE System), Single Day (DXKorea Inc), Song Myung (JIKJI), Stylish (AsiaSoft Inc), Sunflower (JIKJISOFT); (Other) Ranga (TipTopTyp), Suez One (Michal Sahar), Uchen (Christopher J. Fynn), Yinmar (Danh Hong). Most Korean fonts appear to be from foundries that don't maintain public GitHub repos.
